help.title: Alpha Playbook
help.subtitle: testing guide for partner companies
help.quickStartDesc: Set up your workspace in a few minutes.
help.quickStartStep1: Access the URL provided by the AI Office team and log in with your corporate email via Clerk. No passwords are stored by us.
help.quickStartStep2: After login, the onboarding wizard will be displayed automatically. Fill in your company name and project name. You can choose 'Blank Project' or 'Demo Project' (recommended for first test).
help.quickStartStep3: In the onboarding integration step, select 'WhatsApp' and fill in the Z-API details (see 'Connecting WhatsApp' section below). You can also skip and configure later in Settings > Integrations.
help.quickStartStep4: The wizard will ask for name, archetype, and function. For the first test, we recommend the 'Support' archetype with 'Send WhatsApp' and 'Read WhatsApp' tools enabled.
help.quickStartStep5: Send a message to the connected WhatsApp number. The agent should respond automatically within 10-30 seconds. Monitor everything in the Activity Log.
help.whatsAppDesc: AI Office uses Z-API as the WhatsApp Business API provider. Follow the steps below to configure.
help.whatsAppStep1: Go to z-api.io and create an account. The free plan allows basic testing. Note the Instance ID and Token provided in the dashboard.
help.whatsAppStep2: In the Z-API dashboard, scan the QR code with the WhatsApp Business app on the number to be used. Wait until the status changes to 'Connected'.
help.whatsAppStep3: In Z-API, set the webhook URL to: {webhookUrl}. This allows incoming messages to be forwarded to AI Office.
help.whatsAppStep4: Go to Settings > Integrations > WhatsApp. Select 'Z-API' as provider, paste the Instance ID, Token, and phone number in E.164 format (e.g., +5511999999999). Click 'Save Connection'.
help.whatsAppStep5: Click 'Verify Connection'. If everything is correct, the status will change to 'Connected'. Otherwise, check that the QR code was scanned and the Instance ID/Token are correct.
help.whatsAppStep6: Select the agent responsible for answering messages in the 'Handler Agent' dropdown. Only agents with the 'Send WhatsApp' tool enabled will appear.
help.agentsDesc: Agents are autonomous AI units that execute specific tasks in your company.
help.agentsWizardDesc: The wizard guides you through 7 steps: Identity, System Prompt, Tools, Memory, Trigger, Team, and Review. Each step can be adjusted later on the agent detail page.
help.agentsArchetypesDesc: Archetypes are pre-configured templates that define the agent's base behavior:
help.agentsArchetypeSupport: Support — Customer service, ticket management, WhatsApp responses
help.agentsArchetypeSales: Sales — Lead qualification, deal tracking, CRM
help.agentsArchetypeMarketing: Marketing — Campaign creation, audience analysis, content
help.agentsArchetypeDataAnalyst: Data Analyst — Data processing, reports, insights
help.agentsArchetypeContentWriter: Content Writer — Blog posts, copywriting, social media content
help.agentsArchetypeCustom: Custom — Full control, build from scratch
help.agentsToolsDesc: Each agent can access specific tools: WhatsApp (send/read), Email, Web Search, Company Memory, CRM (contacts, deals), Spreadsheets, PIX, and NF-e. Enable only what is necessary for the use case.
help.agentsTriggersDesc: Defines how the agent is activated: 'Always On' (runs continuously), 'Scheduled' (cron), 'Event' (webhook/internal event), 'Manual' (you start it), or 'Agent-triggered' (triggered by another agent).
help.agentsTip: Tip: For alpha testing, we recommend starting with a Support agent in 'Always On' mode with WhatsApp enabled.
help.approvalsDesc: The approval system ensures that high-risk actions are reviewed by a human before being executed.
help.approvalsHowDesc: When an agent tries to execute an action that exceeds its autonomy level, the action is paused and an approval request is created. You can approve or reject with an optional comment.
help.approvalsRiskDesc: Each action has an associated risk level:
help.approvalsRiskLow: Low — Data reads, queries. Executed automatically.
help.approvalsRiskMedium: Medium — Sending messages, creating records. May require approval.
help.approvalsRiskHigh: High — Data modification, payments. Requires approval.
help.approvalsRiskCritical: Critical — Data deletion, large financial operations. Always requires approval.
help.approvalsWhereDesc: Access the 'Approvals' page in the sidebar. The 'Pending' tab shows actions awaiting your review. The 'All' tab shows the complete history.
help.monitoringDesc: Track everything your agents do in real time.
help.monitoringActivityDesc: The Activity Log shows all actions executed by all agents. You can filter by agent, status, and action type. Each entry shows: tool used, tokens consumed, duration, and status.
help.monitoringSessionDesc: Click 'View Session' on any log entry to see the complete sequence of actions in a session. This is useful for understanding the agent's reasoning flow.
help.monitoringAgentDetailDesc: On each agent's page, the 'Activity Log' tab shows only that agent's actions. The 'Memory' tab shows key-value pairs stored by the agent.
help.monitoringTip: Tip: Keep an eye on token consumption and actions per session. If an agent is using too many tokens, review the system prompt.
help.memoryDesc: AI Office has three knowledge layers for your agents.
help.memoryAgentDesc: Each agent maintains its own memory in key-value format. Examples: name of last customer served, context of an ongoing conversation, learned preferences. Memory persists across sessions.
help.memoryCompanyDesc: Upload PDFs, DOCXs, TXTs, or CSVs with company information (FAQs, manuals, price tables). Documents are processed into chunks and indexed for semantic search. Agents with the 'Search Company Memory' tool can query these documents.
help.memoryWikiDesc: The Wiki is a collaborative article repository organized by categories. Ideal for operating procedures, internal policies, and frequently changing information. Agents can also query the Wiki.
help.memoryTip: Tip: For alpha testing, upload at least one document with FAQs or product information. This dramatically improves agent response quality.
help.limitationsDesc: This is an alpha version. The following limitations are known and will be resolved in future versions:
help.limitation1: Response latency: Average agent response time via WhatsApp is 10-30 seconds. During peak times, it may reach 60 seconds.
help.limitation2: Session limit: Each agent session is limited to 20 actions by default. Long sessions may be interrupted.
help.limitation3: Language: The agent responds better in Portuguese when the system prompt is in Portuguese. English prompts may generate mixed responses.
help.limitation4: Media: The agent does not process images, audio, or video received via WhatsApp. Only text messages are processed.
help.limitation5: Concurrency: Multiple simultaneous conversations with the same agent may cause cross-responses in rare cases.
help.limitation6: Virtual Office: The office view is a static representation. Real-time animations will be added in a future version.
help.limitation7: Semantic search: Search quality depends on the quality of ingested documents. Very long documents may have poorly segmented chunks.
help.limitation8: WhatsApp reconnection: If Z-API loses connection, you need to scan the QR code again manually in the Z-API dashboard.
help.bugsDesc: Found an issue? Use the feedback widget to let us know.
help.bugsWidgetDesc: Click the feedback icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen. It is available on all pages.
help.bugsStep4: 4. Describe the problem with as much detail as possible
help.bugsIncludeTitle: What to include in the report
help.bugsInclude1: What you were trying to do
help.bugsInclude3: If possible, the steps to reproduce the issue
help.bugsInclude4: Name of the agent involved (if applicable)
help.bugsInclude5: Approximate time when the issue occurred
help.bugsInclude6: Screenshot (if possible, send by email to the team)
help.bugsEmailDesc: For critical bugs that prevent system use, contact us directly at: suporte@aioffice.dev
